message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI 

This paper discusses the training of Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBMs) using the Contrastive Divergence learning algorithm, which is a common technique in the field of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the feasibility of using the reconstruction error as a stopping criterion during training, which is a topic that falls under the category of Neural Networks (cs.NE). Additionally, RBMs are often used in the fields of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Computer Vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper proposes alternative stopping criteria to detect the decrease in log-likelihood during learning, which is a topic that falls under the category of Statistical Learning (cs.SI).
